passage_text: 1 Do-It-Yourselfers can bring the costs down to $150-$250 for a 12x12 room and $1,000-$3,000 for a small house, but hanging drywall requires a lot of heavy lifting by at least two people, and getting a good finish on drywall requires a lot of patience and practice.

The cost to install drywall is about $1.50 per square foot. After material and labor are added in, the cost per panel can range from around $40.00 to $60.00. A typical 12x12 room, for example, will use 12 panels.

1 For those that want to tape the drywall themselves, plan on paying around $0.10 to $0.32 per square foot to complete the job. 2  A pack of drywall tape can cost anywhere from $4 to $10. 3  For example, the 3M 385 Scotch Drywall Fiberglass Tape retails for $10 to $13.

1 Drywall materials (drywall sheets plus screws or nails, joint compound, tape, etc.) average 25 cents - 65 cents a square foot; professional installation is an additional 85 cents -$1.50 per square foot.
